thread.title: The Canucks are back at home and ready to face the Blues
thread.title_full: The Canucks are back at home and ready to face the Blues - NEWS 1130

author: Ann Schmaltz
title: The Canucks are back at home and ready to face the Blues
text:
Summary The Canucks begin a five-game home stand tonight at Rogers Arena taking on the St. Louis Blues.
Vancouver will serve up the youth movement with Virtanen, McCann and Hutton all in the lineup
Ryan Miller is expected to start for the Canucks.
VANCOUVER (NEWS 1130) – The Canucks begin a five-game homestand tonight at Rogers Arena taking on the defending Central Division champion, St. Louis Blues.
Despite coming off an impressive road trip in California, coach Willie Desjardins is expected to make at least one tweak to his line-up with Sven Baertschi coming out in favour of Jared McCann who was scratched in Tuesday’s win in Los Angeles.
Another rookie, Jake Virtanen from Abbotsford, will finally get the chance to make his home debut. As expected the request for tickets from family and friends was more than he thought. “I’m not sure what the count is, at least 10, 11, 12. Maybe 13.”
Forward Adam Cracknell is the leading the Canucks in goals, and he’s excited to go head-to-head against a number of familiar faces. “I’m nervous for sure. It’s fun playing against old friends, I was with the Blues organization for five or six years.”
The Blues, who lost all three meetings against Vancouver last season, are coming off a 4-2 win last night in Edmonton.
Ryan Miller is expected to start for the Canucks. St. Louis will likely turn to Jake Allen after Brian Elliott went the distance last night.
Puck drop at 7 pm and can be seen live on Sportsnet Vancouver Hockey.
Canucks | hockey | nhl
